content: yes, yes: force of affirmative repetition, unique call of the to-come as the will to repeat itself, affirmation that cites itself, joyous EROS, immeasurable unhappiness, irreducible contamination, affirmation risks citation, le oui qui fait dans la langue un trou aussi étrange que viens, il approuve, affirme, contresigne tout ce “qui est arrivé”
eternal ring, passivity of nonpower, strength in reception, restarts alliance w/out debt, gift w/out credit

who is there? what can respond to viens? dislocated unity of as such, an affirmation that says yes not to a being but to what/who is to come again, there is no incompatibility, contradiction, but no dialectic, no reconciliation
disproportion of present dislocates unity of as such (identity of region or object)
both affirmation and contaminated as a citation
Blanchot’s récit as new thought of citation acc. EROS, repetition of yes that begins by doubling itself, récit unscathed, unique force of a viens that never reproduces itself: viens —sauf

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: Blanchot’s viens, not a command, the price to pay, risk, to think hors la langue
For Derrida l’aller-et-venir part of strange advance of viens (event, affirmation)
j’accumule pour prévenir la prévention
viens calls itself, calls the call, w/ no specular reflection, gives no order, receives no order from law of laws, exchanges nothing, not a prayer, desire, demand
question of viens, question of tutoyer, questions everything [familiarity] w/out totalizing, je voudrais que tu t’approches lentement de ce dont il y va dans ce viens
acc. Heidegger, one must not say that the body alone has spatiality, this would be naive opinion (naïve Meinung) where spiritual being is transposed after the fact (nachträglich) into space
“I [Derrida]” would like you (tu) to slowly approach viens
the proximity of the near is not near, is not proper > tu vs. vous (which is closer?)
la démarche d’un pas: the dis(approach) of a no/pace
tel va-et-vien n’es pas une circulation spéculaire
Venez: an authoritarian, an intimate word; violence kept at furthest distance, furthest distance is near
Blanchot: when he says viens, she approaches slowly, a slowness most foreign to hesitation, in contrast to brevity of authoritarian invitation
slowness: delays, accelerates, displaces time, keeps (guards) infinite distance of moments
pas, like “Viens,” nothing dialectical, not divided by negation or denegation of self, because never present to itself, close to itself: pas de réappropriation [see p. (47)]
“Viens” upsurges (surgit) from a groundless ground (fond sans fond) of an indefinite past
the place of him who calls out venez is also hers
Blanchot disquiets, suspends, infringes on categorical, the self-identity of the category (accusation, judgment) > [infringes] law of identity of “is” in predication
Blanchot: “il avait longtemps cru que le secret comptait moins que son approche”
for Blanchot, every word has the same privilege, each one plays an irreplaceable role
Venez says the provocation of a pas
forgetting is another name for pas, affecting without return the being of “is”
“quand il la tient, il touche cette force d’approche qui rassemble la proximité, et, dans cette proximité, tout le lointain et tout le dehors”
this is the force, or rather the difference of force
Blanchot’s folding displaces typical opposition, hierarchy, value of value
force is excessive because it is different, different than itself, double
Blanchot: “force of proximity that holds under the attraction (attrait)”
to think “starting from (à partir de)” Blanchot departs from the reassuring line of thought of philosophy, thinks tout autre; inappropriate inclusion of tout autre in the same
force of approach defined “à-partir-de” l’éloignement du proche, gathering proximity and distance in an inclusion w/out interiority
knowledge guards, Blanchot keeps this guard and folds it, refolds it, re-employs it, what do we know then?
what does one know of force of de-distancing? and if the custody (garde) of knowledge is distanced? word knowledge would be refolded, re-employed > Blanchot’s reploiement formidable

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: for Blanchot, proximity as an inclusion w/out interiority
the disjoint of near and present, a fissure w/out limits, a fissure that keeps near and present together, maintains w/out maintaining, the singular syntax of sans [and pas too?]

Blanchot’s Heidegger-like fissure that holds together, separation w/out separation, maintenance (nowness) w/out maintenance (nowness), Blanchot’s syntactical use of sans keeps us under its attraction [pas too?]
bivalence of contraband or double bind (of near and far), affects everything that “is,” that is present, that arrives, comes to pass, the essence of the event and event of essence
law w/out law of é-loignement: not essence, but impossible topic of essentiality
“ainsi: quelque chose (quoi? autre-chose) (s’)approche”
Derrida proposes we hear Blanchot’s viens, a coming back w/out memory (le sous-venir sans mémoire), in Heidegger’s Ereignis
the thing can appear near only to what anticipates what the near and proximity are, right there
there is no identity btwn the opposition of near and far
what happens when we treat the essence of proximity as such (like we would the color red)

usually, pour faire droit à un autre texte, Derrida exposes avoidances in a text > Blanchot’s texts one of the few (l’un des très rares) where Derrida is willing, joyfully, to simply withdraw (retrait)
female voice in Pas wonders if Derrida [?] will show economical mastery, render himself untranslatable in the proposal (propos)
Blanchot writes in a way where untranslatability closes off nothing (ne ferme rien), where Witz [see p. 50], slavish and commonplace, finds itself sovereignly thwarted (déjouée)
pas does not find itself in (dans) a labyrinth [topos], it carries itself along like a labyrinth, has the structure of a labyrinth
Blanchot’s strange rhythm of near and fear, of pas, ce démarche, imprints itself on (à) our discourse, chooses words
rarefaction: strict and rigorous law: that the infinitely other can approach by distancing, and distance by approaching
double pas never arresting itself in dialectical negativity of its proceeding nor in the march of a method, the trope of standing-upright [see p. 48]
Blanchot: to sleep in a passivity exactly like death, madness therefore
Blanchot: she comes closer every pas to the instant when she must stop herself
immediately transgressive nature of pas in passivity enables passivity to surmount itself, to affirm
pas-à-pas is a metaphor for de-distancing; pas is immediately singularly multiple
she slips into the water when she is abandoned by ses pas
Blanchot: she would have wanted to devote her final force to interruption and stifling
Blanchot: she would only have precipitated through her death
pas de mort, immeasurable unhappiness is the impossible death
Blanchot: she guarded the hope of escape through the perspective of time
water: a movement w/out pas, beyond all tension (crispation) of pas, degree zero of an infinite metaphor [see p. (84) sans as degree o]
Blanchot: during the night she decided to become the time of men
female voice asks: why her? why is this movement entrusted to the figure of she? Derrida responds by saying, we need to learn infinite patience, be immobilized endlessly in each passage

eau, element where she no longer can find a foothold, also element of “sovereign time,” illusion du sans-pas, of the absence of space, when ses pas have left her, her movement is always entry, penetration [see HYMEN]
we will try to approach later [re: what determines eau (thing, name)]
neither univocity nor dialectics of desire [no reconciled, simple “passion”] can frame the pas of Anne’s final intrusion into her name, her nothingness
via Blanchot, she recognized herself in her (son, [sound]) name, in her nothingness
name, thing, element of name or thing, syllable or letter determines eau as sea, tide, with rhythms and edges (bordures), shores or wrecks (rivages ou naufrages)
“Go (Va)” says the same thing as viens, moves away at same pas, towards a place w/out passage, toward a living (vivre) qui vaut “peut-être même mourir”
unjustifiable and impossible the cutting out (le découpage) to which Derrida is submitting Blanchot’s texts > he does it to slowly approach his unheard of signature, plunge back dans son eau
pas as annulment and preservation of beyond, not a negation of negation, not an interiorization (negation of negation is an effect of pas, a pas)
Blanchot: “at the highest point of contradiction, I was this illegitimate dead person”
[summary of adverbial and substantive reversals in phrase: pas au-delà] adverb pas easily becomes name
play (w/out play) of the w/out (sans) disarticulates every identity, every contradiction > ever since the “the name of death” or nonidentity of double in the name

each pas transgresses the pas [contamination of adverb/noun]; violence of this dislocation, sur une scène tout autre, occurs, increases, when it appears not to displace anything in discursivity, consciousness, in unscathed, assured normality of language [alters subterraneanly]

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: Blanchot: instead of contradiction “I am, I am not,” rubbing (usant) against each other like stones, I write, “I think, therefore I am not”
a debt that annuls itself in being infinite > Derrida's debt to Blanchot’s machination sans machine, which is what interests him, what fascinates him, as does fascination
Blanchot: “come, and return to us what fittingly comes with (convenance) what disappears, the movement of the heart”

Blanchot’s text unchains law of absolute discretion, w/ intractable rigor, which it violates on its own scene w/ measureless obscenity; the only impossible discretion that would surprise his indiscretion > to remain in friendship under the law of the other: the sole sign of friendship, erased in advance
Derrida wants to be violent to Blanchot, won’t just call him tu, must be more violent, more discreet than him, but in a different way
Blanchot: “oh night…you become a delicious passivity”
faux-pas (faut pas) scrambles (brouiller) syntax and semantics, prediscursive graphemes, “pa”
endless dissemination in Blanchot’s Le pas au-déla > just what, so some other thing, than what comes to the title as title
the other of language: the maddest referential opening
no circulation, no dialectic, can close itself (se refermer) on (sur) a determinable quantity of forces
phrase pas-au-delà accumulates indirection of language too quickly, so it marks the excess

event (de-distance of near) (Eriegnis, Entfernung, Enteignis) “before” which philosophy and its pas au déla (thought) are trying to close themselves; event, to come and more than past (à venir et plus que passé) > beyond because the instant I say viens, both pas are crossed in a single pas ——event, going-to-come rather than a coming-and-going (aller-venir plutôt que va-et-vient)
when one gives up rendering account (on s’interdit de rendre compte) of the multiple meanings of pas, one gives up that which takes logic, dialectics, sense toward a coming of the event
risk of interruption is run, programmed in the night, by the récit
Blanchot: passivity is never passive enough, must talk about infinite passivity, beyond all formulations [passivité, passion, passé, pas]
Derrida wonders why Blanchot doesn’t insist [on syntax of pas?], insists for him
Derrida would praise him for this if that were not another kind of mastery
psychoanalysis already warned us, Witz always denies relation to other, always apotropaic
certitude, mastery, puts limits on madness, uses Witz, this slavish, economic vulgarity (of our epoch), masters what occurs in blank spaces [btwn 2 pas], condenses d’avance (in advance)

Blanchot unleashes what Witz contains or denies, a transparent, neutral, impassive surface of language of writing, beyond/before les lignes de rupture ou de front (psychoanalysis, literature, philosophy, political practice/thought)
two pas’ do not touch in the same (must not, need not, that’s how it works et que ça saute); that’s how marks are left (by Blanchot); marking time, pas marks pas
Blanchot on event: he’s always outside it, lightning, can only perpetuate its approach, take its indecision by surprise
le pas de plus, the other pas, haunts or parasitizes, a transgressive passivity, not activity nor labor
what i would like to give you: Viens w/out language overhang (sans aucun langage de surplomb), w/out anything that could name it, designate it from a third place
Blanchot crosses limit of negative and interdiction, while keeping them safe [?]

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: to say “Viens” in quotation marks, le “Viens,” that which we cannot avoid is missed, mais on court la chance de répéter l’alliance ——what i would like to give you: Viens w/out language overhang (sans aucun langage de surplomb), w/out anything that could name it, designate it from a third place
(transgressive, completely passive) pas enacts a crossing of border that leaves border unscathed (indemne): bord sans bord, w/out any dialectical reappropriation

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: “le pas sans pas ne s’arrête pas à une simple pensée de limen”
Blanchot: passage, a thickness w/ its own laws and requirements
jaillissement de cette affirmation (wild affirmation “sauvage”)
Blanchot’s Le Pas au-delà neither critique nor dialectic
simulacrum of circle, EROS, the double pas, he/it that says viens inaugurates it by responding déjà

toujours deux pas, selon le retour éternel de la transgression passive et de l’affirmation répétée (l’affirmation sauvage), double instantaneous interminable preterition, une limite singulière entre la garde et la perte, entre le souvenir aussi et l’oubli > EROS, simulacre de cercle [ring vs. circle]
Blanchot: “more slowly than any slowness, more suddenly than any surprise”
pas est l’oubli, pas d’oubli doublement affirmé (oui, oui)
double pas provokes double instantaneous but interminable preterition, forms a singular limit btwn keeping and loss, remembering and forgetting

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: an infinite patience that crosses the limit in one stroke, a forgetting that overflows all philosophical and psychoanalytic determinations w/out omitting their pertinence
[compare description of pas here (not a word, a cry?) to glas]
why is it always the image of a woman? [Derrida ignores question?]
affirmation of double pas, alliance w/out contract au tout autre (yes, yes), double band of a pact w/out pact

from where the right to interrupt? unjustifiable violence of interruption, nothing more servile, indiscreet, unspeakable than generalizing, appropriating the unique, breaking the seal of an absolute singularity [re: citing from Friendship, on single friendship btwn Bataille & Blanchot]
waters (parages), where every machine is stopped
viens calls la mort de l’autre, venue de l’autre, who calls and names itself
Blanchot: work of mourning is the inverse of dying
neither word nor syllable eau, o, could signify affection by which what departs from come relates to itself from the other: there was no water
repetition of yes, yes, allies one yes to other, refolds the other, gives sens to a singularity that should have none > viens never arrives because of this repetition
what arrives would always arrive at edge (au bord), shore (rive), [death], the impossible arrival of viens
the first sentence, no matter how inaugural it may seem, always recites itself in advance
from Blanchot, Derrida learns rigor of word gently (doucement)

mastery, getting by too well, je m’en tirais trop bien, does not allow chance of event, must be disabled, wrecked, for something other to happen finally: the best & worst > la dérive [Blanchot’s] guards against security, anchorage, property and against, perhaps, ce qui arrive, le pire ou le meilleur, venant d’en face ou de l’abîme [?]

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: the figure of the other, sans figure
affirm viens w/out possible return or as eternal return of the other
échouer, échec, échéance, chance; the chance (échec ou écheance) of the event
Blanchot: circle of law is this: must be a crossing for there to be a limit, uncrossable that in its desire, its call, has already crossed the line [appele à franchir]
Blanchot: desire (le faux pas)
death: “always the horizon of law” and from which is withdrawn “the benefit of an event”
pas de don has to recall itself in order to come about: knot (pas) of truth, truth of knot (pas) > begins to be ensnared in trap of law
le surgissement, calling someone to his own proper name in water > analyze baptism from this gift of the name
gift hands over to anonymity, forgetfulness of name, au pas de nom, au pas du nom
[récit] btwn 2 affirmations, legendary suspense, in which the undecided lets itself be lured (se laisse attirer)
Blanchot’s neutral must pass through very form of what it neutralizes
Derrida questions himself about whether he hides a new economy, new mastery behind the undecidable > [responds] nothing that doesn’t expose itself & remove itself
it is not the meaning of viens but the pas de sens that thwarts the closure of language

Viens, at the same time unique and copy (exemplaire), Blanchot’s récits as exemplary citations, their unique power is that the unscathed possibility of unique (le sauf) remains in reserve from which “I would emerge” to say, to one of them,“Viens”

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: “écriture comme trace d’un mouvement sans origin, sans fin, sans langage, sans…”
she is the pronoun of a nameless one [see p. (70) here, figure is a he]

“terrifyingly ancient” time, absolute crypt, requires the récit (reciting, it can be a matter of nothing but that), ce récit [of viens], neither relation to the event nor event itself > pas d’événement, pas de concept
forgetting beyond all our categories of forgetting (beyond economy of repressions working toward protection)

every revolution needs to take account of Blanchot’s forgetting, forgetting w/out forgetting, a forgetting beyond the protection of repression, a forgetting that describes the whole history of dissimulation > pas d’autre ——X that is l’oubli tout autre is also the same X of philosophy, science
science is a dissimulation of tout autre, philosophy also > Blanchot keeps “old name” to attempt to give an account of this
viens doesn’t give place to any order, w/out law, w/out anything namable that may be desired, demanded from a lack

chance and necessity de la langue, la nécessité, la chance, marque encore la chance, the risk: que l’autre de la langue se passe dans le pas au-delà de la langue, not its other but the other sans elle (language)
ce désir de la paralysie qui n’arrête jamais
Blanchot’s figures, room, sea, staircase, etc. are going to be effaced, figures san figure; not places in space, but they have a certain horizontality (thus the attribution of spatial horizon)
nothing presents itself [in approach of “terrifyingly ancient,” terrifyingly becoming “subject” not accessory adverb], fors l’obscène (save the obscene), what awaits as forgetting
Blanchot: approach, reanimate the instant, summons (appel), reconquer [madness?]
Blanchot: lucidity could do nothing but render my paralysis infinite
Blanchot: the figure’s disappearance, most human truth, truth closest to “me”
double pas, before, beyond all time, resounds in viens, stairway scene, un pas de marche, w/out figure that disappears in it, w/out representation, w/out truth, w/out visibility
citation of récit sets in moment (mot-ment)
[doesn’t the man drown her? relying on his identity to be able to say viens? answer: I does not exist before viens] cette contrepartie, cette contre-allée
Blanchot: summons to cross the uncrossable has already crossed the line
paralysis that does not prohibit anything, that makes movement [see ROP p. 21] > le faux mouvement qui procède selon le faut-pas du désir et franchit la limite
the one who says “I” depends by his name, in his identity, on terrifyingly ancient event of another viens, le même pourtant > the drowned (noyé) as the one who says “I”
Blanchot: dying separates us endlessly from ourselves
the call of death precedes me, it is death and the word (mort/mot) that’re called in the viens > I call myself dead, marcher in my name > w/out name before viens
elles are not women
vigilance (jalousie) links (enchaînant) affirmation to its repetition, bond (lien) w/out pact, w/out debt

neutralization of sexual difference by calling her elle (anonymous, improper name), the de-distancing of viens instructs le pas de différence sexuelle; she is on the other side of the faux pas of the il that does not accompany me: neuter of affirmation, alliance, yes, yes, annulus of récit
Blanchot makes a laughing stock (fait rire) of the opposition btwn clarification (explicitation) and cut (coupure) > l’éclat de rire
la chose est sapée (dressed, the thing is undermined)

Blanchot makes a laughing stock (fait rire) of the opposition btwn clarification (explicitation) and cut (coupure) > l’éclat de rire ——isn’t the thought of la paralyse a thought of the obscene Medusa? good for laughter too
she/it (elle) is not thought or word (parole), nor what what we dissimulate under these words as their terrifying evidence: their very dissimulation

logic of double band arrests laughter and shamelessness (l’impudeur) when they shield themselves (se défendent) against anguish and affirmation > contamination btwn laughs and violations is inevitable

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: those who think denial is a simple gesture are more sheltered (plus abrités) than others

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: [Blanchot displaces logic of disavowal & denial] pas-de-dénégation doesn’t mean apotropaic can ever be suspended, it is a “double chute,” il garde la chute contre elle-même > perverts up to the limit perversion and its other

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: Blanchot: I forget nothing, it is in this way que j’appartiens à l’oubli
to save those drowning, lui donnant plutôt la parole, le sauf

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: Blanchot: I turned around myself, given up to wander (errer)
Blanchot: “more secret and more interior than speech of the innermost heart” > “the secret is w/out depth (sans profondeur)”
assimilating interiority of mastery can also be terrible thus compulsion toward outside could be defense > sauf le dehors, tout sauf le dehors
“from an earlier time (autrefois)” not a date, not past of an event, it’s the structure of a relation to it, the word, the moment

what does sauf mean? save them from an outside not even proper to them? sauf: secret (dérobé), powerful word, language fascinates starting form it > like sans, pas: crumbles, precludes the set from understanding itself: “rien sauf le dehors” > sauvetage project part of writing project

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: to say viens to a unique word (parole), somewhat plural (un singulier sauf à être plurielle), to say “Come” to her, that word, is to sacrifice right to call (appeler) another and say you to him [?]
is Blanchot’s diabolical démarche: 1) a mastery, which presumes to escape its own trap, believes the maze, the labyrinth, the staircase are a space w/ traps 2) or, very spacing of its pas?
“singular materiality” of pas goes beyond nihilist impasse, and “materialist theses”
political consequence of “materialist theses,” which still mark time (piétinent) in metaphysics [link to nihilism]
diabolical duplicity works with mastery in mind, lays traps in labyrinth, sees staircase as a space to lay traps, not as spacing of its very own pas?
Blanchot: the work (l’ensemble) is trying to devour and devour itself endlessly into nothing

diabolism, double of sovereignty, its trap must take on all forms of sovereignty: méconnaissance and forgetting w/out remains; sovereign traps the devil, lui donnant ainsi raison, risks leaving him the last word
Blanchot’s tutoieing (viens) breaks w/ indiscreet familiarity, not negative theology, but describes its law, its jurisdiction, its perversion > can say toi w/out tutoieing [& reverse]
she/it has no place, only what comes before place, what places itself before the place of every proper name (the Thing, pronoun, prénom)
for Blanchot, theological discourse is the most perverse
Blanchot: key word to enigma is this enigma, capable not of devouring me but associating me w/ its devouring avidity
drowning (noyade) is not a simple figure to be dragged into abyss of this other word (parole)
riveted by fascination itself
elles, neither subjects nor things, a visibility that can’t see itself
eau is a rebus, a morsel (morceau) or moment of a word (thing, letter, names, syllable, cry) > like sans, pas, sauf, rat, not a theme, sense, signifier
Blanchot: looking at them (elles) as if they had risen from their graves (tombeaux), and, I remain in their fascination > c’est la scène d’eau, la noyade et l’éventualité de viens

[list of Blanchot’s many sans constructions] X sans X forms the trace or the pas of the toute autre that acts on itself there (s’y agit) > degree o (eau); il reste un reste sans reste de ce passage (il y a —pas—rien, un texte, un récit, déjà)
the gift w/out knowing (sans le savoir), the sole possible, the impossible

sans remarks same X w/out annulling it, springless spring (ce ressort sans ressort), this re-trait leaves everything intact (sauf, indemne) in appearance [absolute heterogenous neutrality w/out negation], at the same time it has abducted, erased, absolute rapidity of dispossession (dérapage)

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: double pas, its absolute heterogeneity, deprives of nothing save its identity to self, which prevents distancing from self > double pas, absolute rarefaction w/out the least lack
sans lets come back what is dissimulated as tout autre and can only be dissimulated
formulation of sans is impossible; sheltered (abrité) by paleonym w/out relation to it, invests paleonym w/ tout autre > sans—trace de pas
intempestive (untimely), that which we are least prepared to follow
near depthless abyss in mise en scène of “Viens”
Blanchot neutralizes all the words of order of our modernity: meaning, language, discourse, writing
sans is infinitely passive to tout autre that approaches it, sans auto-affects itself by tout autre

wanting (le vouloir) to break fascination always effect of fascination? why break it? I love and desire fascination, any desire w/out it? [tu me fascine, je t’aime]; viens, word of fascination, defers in difference what it cannot break with—dare that another dissimulation not come
always the other’s fascination, no opposition to fascination, only differences of force

[on not citing his sources] the worst méconaissance of Blanchot’s text, hand over incommensurable in it to the market, the hierarchy, the dominant effects tied to name & law, but [other voice] there’s always benefits of mastery for sovereign renunciation, it’s gonna happen, il faut en rendre compte, the gift itself never forgets itself, nor the forgetting
immensity cannot be measured, but dominant effects occur whether you want them to or not, and you must give an account of/for it
at the indistinct edge of sea, viens said just once between us, desire to go out to sea
read, re-read endlessly, w/out help of Blanchot, w/out my help
it’s on the border that everything arrives, just misses arriving, or misses le bord d’arriver > il n’y a pas de bord en soi [there’s no border in itself]
the immense always brings us back to the water
all paradoxes de la marge, de la marche, de la limite multiply when they are determined as borders (en bords)
can one love anything other than the name? that which still lets self omit itself, so it can represent itself

le désir de toucher au bord a eu lieu (has taken place), the touching has not, not arrived at its term, sa rive, sa marge ou son bord, sa berge (bank) (ce qui garde et met à l’abri, contre une chute ou une noyade)

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: border of approach dissimulates itself w/out presenting itself elsewhere

to land, to approach is what creates a border, to approach a strange slow movement of drawing near, does not attain goal, nor tamper with end, does not touch the border, which only remains one so long as approaching never touches it [border of approach ≈ to-come of event]
approach is not an originary event

ne-pas, not negation brought to bear on a position or a negation, but on “singular undecidability of the approach of the other”—unable to go nearer or father: suffice to disable every dialectical schema
Blanchot: ideal negation, deferred assassination that is language, my language does not kill anyone (woman can always die, her death announced, already present in my language)
Blanchot’s example of how speaking negates the existent of which it speaks: ‘This woman!’ > Hölderlin, Mallarmé, all poets, felt act of naming is marvelous/disquieting

faire trembler d’abord (trembling, first approach): denial of fear, frightens more, a fascination, la moindre possibilité de s’arriver, in trembling one renounces mastery, use, domination, one does not know how to sign its effects > pas d’insistance distances itself on first approach
Blanchot come is said so that elle can cry out its name
cette femme, not yours, but the name for you, not a part of you, doesn’t possess you, addresses you > [she responds?] my name is unique, and you hide it, forget it
death as the impossibility of dying, à partir de laquelle s’annonce la mort sans mort ——faux pas de mort

if being is another name for forgetting, places forgetting in a crypt, forgets forgetting, in naming forgetting one makes it disappear under its name [(un)names], vs. pas sous le nom d’oubli > le reste sans reste de cet effacement qui ne s’efface plus, voilà ce qu’il y a peut-être, par chance, mais qui n’est pas ou qui est pas
dissemination does not play w/ the multiple, plural, dispersion, the apart (épars), but with the unique, the unique and itself
to give must forget all the way up to what is given, one gives without having self (sans s’avoir) [see p. (23) say “come” w/out knowing, having, seeing]
forgetting must guard itself (se guarder) to preserve the gift, so the gift can give, the bank (berge) and contamination poison the gift

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: Blanchot: this laughter ran along border of space, w/out crossing it, seemed to be that space
must be able to reject the gift, vomir ce qui t’appelle à dire viens, forget in order to reject the poison, to not guard the gift

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: approach (unpresentable time of récit) thwarts assurance of negation, negative theology and dialectics
the event adrift (en dérive) abducts (enlève) its simple past from an indefinite background of habitus or repetition, fond sans fond [quasi-now of récit]
Derrida always interrupts Blanchot’s citations very arbitrarily, he is interested, like Blanchot, in logic of parts and partage
decision not only suspended but understood (sous-entendue), I say understood, btwn 2 readings
if I write slowly you can hear si j’étais là (if/yes I was there) in three ways
the inner rhythm of sauf (contamination), always altered, always unscathed, “j’ai tout, sauf…” > “sauf que je voudrais en être débarrassé”

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: “il faut: laisser indemne, ne pas laisser indemne, quoi? tout, sauf—le sauf qu’il faut laisser indemne, ne pas laisser indemne”

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: in a moment of extreme, precipitous virtuosity, where o (mort, fors, faux, faut, zéro, mot) resonates everywhere and nom turns to mon, Derrida asks himself if his policing overzealousness [to unmask the absence of the name, le pas-de-nom] deciphers identities [maur/chot, m’: o], wants to catch everything in a dragnet (filet)
border edge, hidden vicinity (un voisinage caché) [not depth]
structure of name, text, signature complicates premises when one precipitates oneself toward the guarantee of filiation [does jealousy always overdetermine?]
acc. Derrida, all [?] Blanchot’s books concern fascinating ellipsis (l’ellipse fascinante) of what leaves the sea
o as degree 0 (of appearance), double 0 as “power of 0 and 2” > the pas de Sans-Nom, EROS, neither gathers, identifies, nor excludes the one or the other
even if we could cite everything (read everything), the whole would still be lacking
when I say viens, I scream (hurle) and hold back (retiens) a murmur no one can hear
death, the other name of viens (both only reach the other)
when you say “I love you” does that make me unique?
must forget the question of your self, of your uniqueness, and love viens, the unique, not a name, not an impersonal infinitive
friendship gives anonymity in the name, if it is possible, it hands over (livre) le nom sans nom
in blanchâtre is cachalot, sperm-whale displaced in each syllable, economy of the syllable
if there was one [name], the signature, the anagrammatic, would lose name in infinite measure of its keeping [absolute guard], so > plus de nom (visible name might hide tout autre name)

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: name is no more its infinitely divisible elements than it is dispersed in them like foam in anonymous sea [Kant’s simple/composite]
ces mots le blanchâtre près de l'eau (j'y entends le déplacement silencieux, dissimulé d'un cachalot, sperm-whale)

double band is structure of name said to be proper, anonymity is the effect, whether by monumentalization (sauf, the unscathed) or effacement (seeds, dispersion); gift of name is corrupted in advance dans le pas-de-nom [plus-de-nom] > what takes place in and beyond language: leaves the fold of this folding back

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: [re: Blanchot] name we know him by can serve as a hiding place (cache), throw readers off track into complacency of police investigation > thus plus de nom
mais la vigilance de l’autre peut aussi rester: 1) lose your name 2) can’t/don’t want to throw it away
Derrida’s ideal to drown in true sea of Blanchot’s text, to have loved it as the original first name
Blanchot: “friendship for the demand to write which excludes all friendship”
you want to lose your name, and w/ tout autre calculus, you don’t want to get out of it [vigilance]
I call to you to protect you against the nameless
Blanchot: solemn and noble procession toward what goal? and then forgetfulness came
Blanchot: prophets birth tongues, and feel desires they can’t support—before the immensity
